reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an outstanding hotel of the highest calibre. The standard of furnishing in public rooms and bedrooms is very high and the service is excellent. It is wonderfully located and minutes walk from the station. It showns all the signs of a family managed hotel with great attention to detail. We long to return.
reviews.title: This is THE place...1st class yet relaxed.
Fantastic
reviews.text: This hotel is not the most expensive in Stresa but offers all the elegance and panache you could want. From the beautiful front lawn facing the lake, to the exquisitely appointed lobby-lounge area with very comfortable seating for quiet conversation and drinks. Elegant dining room overlooks the front lawn and lake and offers excellent dinners (we ate there) as well as a full American type breakfast (included). Be sure and book a room with a balcony facing the lake for the utmost experience. The rooms were furnishied "to the nines" with all the trimmings. You can't go wrong with this choice for your hotel stay in Stresa. It will knock your socks off. Free parking available next door in large lot.

reviews.title: This is an EXCELLENT Hotel
reviews.text: Beautiful setting, attentive staff, family run. Gardens immaculate, breakfast superb, even provided complimentary hotel transport to station when taxi was unavailable. Stresa is a wonderful mixture of gardens and atmospheric little streets and squares. Perfectly situated for exploring the area particularly for Borromeo Islands. Hope to go back. The staff went that extra mile to make our stay enjoyable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I made this selection after extensive research on Trip Advisor, and the Hotel La Palma proved to be a good choice. We booked a Junior Suite for five nights and asked for as quiet a room as possible. The result was a 5th floor room at the far end of the hallway with a panoramic view of the lake and islands. It was an easy walk to the town center.
reviews.title: a good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large and comfortable as was the bathroom. The latter featured the usual rather inscrutable shower but it worked very well once you learned that the overhead fixture was activated by pulling the control above the valve. The air conditioning was efficient and silent.
reviews.title: Great for the money

likes.liked: — The balcony with views of the lake and proximity to the town and amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the La Palma as part of a holiday encompassing France, Italy and Switzerland. We have high standards and the La Palma fulfilled all our expectations. We had a lovely room with magnificent views and had to drag ourselves away from our balcony each morning to explore the lake. The rooms and bathrooms are in very good condition, the staff are helpful and breakfast offered a wide selection of options. If you are going to Stresa, which is a lovely town, then stay at the La Palma, you can't go wrong!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!

likes.liked: — The excellent condition throughout the hotel.

reviews.title: Hotel La Palma
reviews.text: Large, comfortable rooms with (relatively) spacious balconies directly facing the lake and Borromée Islands.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent receptionist.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurant is rather average, but who cares when there are so many very nice little italian restaurants all around
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Good Food some staff could do better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend this place. Great rooms (we had a 4th floor lake view), quiet, comfortable; terrific service. Breakfast (buffet) is included--great selection available there. The decor was a bit dated (esp. in the hallway), but this added to the charm of the place for me. Overall, the place is quietly luxurious. The fresh gardenias at each table (from the owners' garden?? in back?) were a marvelous in the dining room. Within walking distance of the train station.
reviews.title: Reasonable hotel just not very inspiring

likes.disliked: — The chairs on the lawn outside the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at La Palma from 3rd to the 10th July 2013. We have been to Italy many times but this holiday was the best yet.
reviews.title: La Palma Hotel Stresa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are 79 and 74 but fit and well and we asked for a high floor, lakeside view. We certainly got what we wanted-room 408.
reviews.title: An excellent note.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Splendid views, excellent room with Jacuzzi, wonderful food, friendly and helpful staff, marvellous furnishings and a pleasure to go back to after a long day out.
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We like walking-there were many. We like local bars and cafès-superb. We booked through Inghams- very ,very good.
reviews.title: A Great & comfortable Hotel in perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weather was superb. We would recommend this hotel without reservation
reviews.title: Got to come back - the hotel is great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having visited several other Italian lakes over the past decade we visited Lake Maggiore for the first time and reckon it's one of the nicest - probably no surprise there.
reviews.title: Summer '13

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The town of Stresa has plenty going for it and is an excellent centre for visiting the Borromean Islands and other other parts of this large lake. There are some excellent walks above the town - mostly (remarkably!) well marked. The ferries are regular and quite cheap (a Rover Ticket from Tomassucci Viaggi is excellent value); the trains to Milan and Domodossola (for the tremendous Centovalley narrow gauge train over the top to Switzerland) are cheap (though check timings); and the Funivia to the top of Mt Mottarone gives great views over the lake.
reviews.title: Must be one of the best views in the world from the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've always liked italian hotels, and are fond of the 'victorian grandeur' that many seem to see as a poor relation of glass and stainless steel boutique hotels. The Hotel La Palma is definitely an excellent example of the former type: beautifully cleaned and cared-for from the thick carpets to the crystal chandeliers.
reviews.title: Excursions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided against the (expensive) option of a room with lake-view and were more than happy with a side-view (you could see the hills) with a much larger balcony than at the front...and much quieter. The room was plenty big enough; the air-conditioning was very efficient and the cleaners were thorough and very friendly - particularly when we tried out our Italian on them. And you could get BBC1 on the TV - such a relief from the usual CNN!
reviews.title: Romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was excellent - five choices for both first and second courses every night, and no repeats, followed by cheese/biscuits and some excellent desserts. The self-service salad to begin meals was disappointing: always the same, and terribly English with its reliance upon tomato and wilted lettuce.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Not sure why this doesn't show up in popular list but my family
reviews.title: Hotel La Palma

likes.disliked: — Nice pool but no real beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and I loved this hotel. We have a wonderful large room with
reviews.title: Can find little fault with this hotel

likes.liked: — The location on the lakefront but so central
likes.disliked: — lack of fresh fruit for breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a balcony overlooking Lake Maggiore. The staff were very helpful and eager to please and the location was perfect -- near the ferry dock and not far from restaurants.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend La Palma

likes.disliked: — Mattresses are usually firmer than I prefer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the lakefront and only five minutes walk from the town centre, La Palma combines comfort and elegance. We had a great room overlooking the lake and the Borromean Islands, plenty of space and a whirlpool bath.
reviews.title: Loved La Palma
Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: The bar and restaurant are well-staffed and comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We first visited this hotel a number of years ago and had a beautiful family room overlooking the lake. This time, travelling as a couple, we booked a room with a balcony and lateral lake view. The room was spotless but small so we opted to upgrade to a lake view room with balcony. It was perfect and the reception staff were very accommodating. The hotel itself is very well kept and the outdoor rooftop sky bar is a must. Breakfast was good with the usual variety. We opted to eat dinner in the hotel on two evenings and we enjoyed our meals. If we were ever in the area again, we would revisit this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room (a 6th floor suite with terrace, actually), the view, the breakfast -- all exceptional. Breakfast, which was on the ground floor opening on to the lawn, was especially pleasant and with a fine selection. In all respects ( except, perhaps, for the bathroom which, nevertheless, was sufficient for our needs), this a is 5-star property. the Internet connection, however, was (as they say in the IT business) somewhat kludgy. Pillows were too firm for my comfort. Gym needs more equipment.
reviews.title: On the Cannes Croisette, but without the traffic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A wonderful stay at this delightful hotel - everything was perfect.
reviews.title: Exceptional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff, room, location, food were first class.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The food was excellent with extensive choice every evening, beautifully presented and cooked.
reviews.title: The Best Overall Experience in Stresa
We'll go back
reviews.text: First, having seen some of the reviews of Stresa hotels, I think I undersold the Simplon in Baveno in a previous review, it really is a beautiful hotel. Anyway, back to La Palma in Stresa. We loved it. The room was not over large but comfortable, two chairs with arms (not armchairs) and a fine side view of the lake and Isola Bella. The balcony had two chairs and an occasional table. The public rooms are well furnished with sofas and armchairs, so if the weather is really poor (we had one day of non stop rain) there is plenty of room to relax inside. The garden to the front is has plenty of seating and is perfect to sit in the sun or shade and watch the world go by. On the roof is a terrace and bar with views over the lake; up there the evenings are magical as the sun goes down over the mountains.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the dining room the tables are well spaced out and nicely set. At the touch of a button the full length windows descend below ground level, which opens the room to the garden. The food was plentiful and beautifully presented; some of it was not to our taste, but that's our problem.
reviews.title: Just beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we really enjoyed our stay. There is plenty to do and see in Stresa and of course there are the ferries to the islands. We look forward to returning.
reviews.title: Perfect honeymoon stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at the end of June in a side lake view room on the fourth floor and had the most magnificent view of Isola Bella. La Palma is a very well run hotel in a great location which offers considerable outside space/seating - decent sized balconies, roof top sky bar, gardens immediately in front of the hotel and across the road, and space beside the pool alongside the lake. Flowers abound in Stresa and La Palma does not let the side down as it is bedecked with pink geraniums and jasmine. We stayed B&B and service at breakfast was very professional and the choice was wide. Would not hesitate in recommending this hotel.
reviews.title: Location is Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travel tips: for independent travellers wishing to transfer by public bus from Malpensa, note that your seat must be reserved at least the day before and if your flight is delayed and nobody is booked on the next bus, that one won't turn up - we found out the hard way! A visit to Lake Orta is well worth it (€3.05 each way) but there are only two buses per day from Stresa (at 10am and 2pm, returning at 3pm and 6pm) and the bus is only small so if you don't get on at the first stop opposite the church you may get left behind.
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the La Palma in june to celebrate my wifes parents golden wedding anniversary. we booked 2 no junior suites with lake views
reviews.title: NEARLY VERY GOOD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms we found to be very good they were large with lovely balconies and lake views . The bathrooms were also very spacious. The hotel was very clean
reviews.title: So beautiful and fabulous service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel has a good rooftop sunbathing area and an lakeside pool and sun-bathing terrace
reviews.title: La Palma offers high standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only thing that let the hotel down was the evening meals . we had booked half board to save having to go into town every night and found that although was not bad it was not as good as some of the restaurants in town
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

likes.liked: — The balcony view and jacuzzi bathtub
likes.disliked: — Needed a triple room and the extra bed (cot) was a bit uncomfortable

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: We would stay here again but on bed and breakfast

reviews.title: out of season
reviews.text: A grand looking hotel by night, with an attractive foyer reception and bar area, our 140 euro per night was not really well spent., albeit november is evidently in the closed season.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was sparse - the "double bed was very hard and was really two singles held together by a sheet, and the blaketing was minimal. The room lacked little touches, - no face flannels, a shower door that constantly swung open, no information on the town, or the area.
reviews.title: Classy Italia, Stressa and La Palma

likes.liked: — Stylish but relaxed atmosphere, good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Closed season apart, the two course -(no choice) in house dinner was bland, we paid a lot less for an a la carte meal in a much humbler restaurant in a town just up the Lake.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL LAKE MAGGIORE

likes.liked: — Lake View and good choice of vegetarian food dishes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006
reviews.text: The breakfast was cold only, and unimaginative.
reviews.title: Lovely La Palma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff however were very attentive and charming, I imagine in the summer season the place has much more life, and the room charge would not be relevant, bearing in mind the location.
reviews.title: Wonderful Setting, La Palma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: We stayed and the Palma mid-july 2007 in room 607 (corner suite). We initially contacted the hotel by email and they were extremely nice and helpful in helping us choose the right arrangement for us as we were travelling with 2 kids (2 & 10 y/o).
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Very nice staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not a new hotel but it is perfectly maintained and operated by the family and you can feel the personal/family touch.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — The closeness to the main twon although far enough to be quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very comfortable hotel. We had a superior room with lake view and balcony, not huge, but with enough space for two armchairs, a table, a desk and decent clothes storage. The décor is pretty standard, but everywhere was clean and in good condition.
reviews.title: A Relaxing Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel are a big plus, all genuinely helpful and friendly without being intrusive.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel by Lake Maggiore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Parking was free and right under the hotel, so very convenient, and the buffet breakfast better than some we have experienced.
reviews.title: Grazie La Palma!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate out each evening in Stresa, a pleasant 5 minute amble along the front, where there is plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Serenity by the Lakeside

likes.disliked: — no air conditioning in dining room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: We would recommend the ‘Tourist Train’ trip that travels from the station in Stresa to Locarno at the top of Lake Maggiore, along the mountain side and then allows you to return by boat. A great day full of views!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just got back from two weeks in Italy and spent 5 nights at the Hotel Palma in Stresa. We had a lovely room overlooking the beautiful lake. Our room had a balcony which we used quite frequently. It was quite large by European standards with a large bathroom as well. I would suggest that if you book a room you try to get one facing the lake with a balcony.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

likes.liked: — Great Location with fantastic lake view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The service was excellent and the staff was quite helpful. The location is great only about two blocks from the main town of Stresa. Breakfast was typical of what you find in a larger European hotel with lots of breads, meats, cheeses and sweets. I would have liked more fresh fruit but that is my only, very minor, criticism.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

likes.liked: — Beautiful hotel with wonerful rooms, great location, fine staff and restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were in Stresa in mid- September so the summer crowds had left but the weather was still very nice. During the time we were there most of the tourists were older German, English or American tourists. There were not many young or middle aged adults like us but that was ok as we met many friendly people.
reviews.title: Loved the La Palma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We took our family of 14 and stayed at LaPalma for 2 nights. We wish it had been longer. Wonderful hotel and staff, best hotel we stayed in during our 11 day trip through northern Italy. Fine resaurant as well. Reasonable cost for the high quality of accommodations and food. We all want to return and stay longer.
reviews.title: Beware!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did an overnight stop at the La Palma at the beginning of August. The hotel is superb. Very clean and spacious. Our room was excelent with beautiful views over the lake. This is by far the best hotel we have stayed in in Italy and you really felt that you were staying somewhere classy.
reviews.title: A Luxurious Finale to Italia

likes.liked: — Fabulous views, touch of luxury, great position
likes.disliked: — slow/non-existent drink service on front lawn
